text: C-125-B/C-125-C:  Revised Proposed Successor-in-Interest Order

text: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT
label: H3

text: FOR THE DISTRICT OF NEVADA
label: H3

text: UNITED STATES OF AMERICA,
label: BODY

text: Plaintiff,
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: Plaintiff-Intervenor,
label: BODY

text: vs.

label: BODY

text: a corporation, et al.,
label: BODY

text: Defendants.
label: BODY

text: MINERAL COUNTY,
label: BODY

text: Proposed-Plaintiff-Intervenor
label: BODY

text: vs.
label: BODY

text: WALKER RIVER IRRIGATION DISTRICT
label: BODY

text: a corporation, et al.

text: IN EQUITY NO. C-125-ECR

text: Subproceedings: C-125-B & C-125-C
label: BODY

text: REVISED PROPOSED ORDER
label: HH1

text: CONCERNING SERVICE ISSUES
label: H3

text: PERTAINING TO DEFENDANTS
label: H3

text: WHO HAVE BEEN SERVED
label: H3

text: In the C-125-B and C-125-C subproceedings, the Court has required the United States of
label: BODY

text: America (“United States”) and the Walker River Paiute Tribe (“Tribe”) (Plaintiff and Plaintiff-
label: BODY

text: Intervenor in Subproceeding C-125-B) and Mineral County (Proposed Plaintiff-Intervenor in
label: BODY

text: Subproceeding C-125-C) (collectively the “Plaintiff Parties”) to serve significant numbers of
label: BODY

text: Case 3:73-cv-00128-RCJ-WGC Document 2 Filed 02/23/11 Page 1 of 9
label: BODY

text: C-125-B/C-125-C:  Revised Proposed Successor-in-Interest Order
label: BODY

text: water rights holders in the Walker River Basin.1  In their respective subproceedings, the Plaintiff
label: BODY

text: Parties have engaged in extensive service efforts on these water rights holders over a number of
label: BODY

text: years.  This Order addresses several overlapping service issues that have emerged from these
label: BODY

text: efforts and are common to both subproceedings.
label: BODY

text: Having reviewed and considered the record concerning service in these subproceedings,
label: BODY

text: and the related filings and arguments of counsel, the Court has concluded that, with regard to
label: BODY

text: defendants who have been served, service of the pleadings in these actions must have a defined
label: BODY

text: end point and the Plaintiff Parties should be relieved of the duty (1) to track such defendants
label: BODY

text: perpetually, (2) to re-serve them if and when they acquire additional water rights in the same
label: BODY

text: subproceeding, or (3) to serve successors-in-interest to water rights if and when defendants who
label: BODY

text: have been served transfer any of these rights.  In the interest of ensuring that service will have an
label: BODY

text: end point, this Order addresses the treatment and finality of service with respect to defendants
label: BODY

text: who transfer their claims to water rights after having been served, defendants who have been
label: BODY

text: served and acquire additional claims to water rights at issue in the same subproceeding, and the
label: BODY

text: obligations of named defendants who transfer a claim to water right prior to service.  This Order
label: BODY

text: also addresses the treatment of successors-in-interest to claims to water rights following the
label: BODY

text: death of a defendant who has been served.
label: BODY

text: NOW THEREFORE, the Court FINDS and ORDERS as follows:
label: BODY

text: 1  To date, for example, the United States reports that it has served over 3,800 persons and entities pursuant to this
label: BODY

text: Court’s Case Management Order, (C-125-B Doc. 108), and Mineral County reports that it has served over 1,000
label: BODY

text: Walker River Decree water rights holders, (C-125-C Doc. 496).
label: BODY

text: Case 3:73-cv-00128-RCJ-WGC Document 2 Filed 02/23/11 Page 2 of 9
label: BODY

text: C-125-B/C-125-C:  Revised Proposed Successor-in-Interest Order
label: BODY

text: Treatment of Successors-in-Interest As a Result of an Inter Vivos2 Transfer:
label: BODY

text: 1. The Court finds that after litigation has been commenced, the substitution or joinder of a
label: BODY

text: successor-in-interest is governed by Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 25 (“Fed. R. Civ. P.
label: BODY

text: 25”).  Hilbrands v. Far East Trading Co., 509 F.2d 1321, 1323 (9th Cir. 1975); Fischer
label: BODY

text: Bros. Aviation, Inc. v. NWA, Inc., 117 F.R.D. 144, 146 (D. Minn. 1987) (citing
label: BODY

text: Froning's, Inc. v. Johnston Feed Serv., 568 F.2d 108, 110 (8th Cir. 1978)); P P Inc. v.
label: BODY

text: McGuire, 509 F. Supp. 1079, 1083 (D.C.N.J. 1981) (citing 7A Charles Alan Wright &
label: BODY

text: Arthur R. Miller, Federal Practice and Procedure § 1958 (1972)).  Fed. R. Civ. P. 25(c)
label: BODY

text: governs the substitution of successors-in-interest that are the result of an inter vivos
label: BODY

text: transfer and provides in relevant part that “[i]f an interest is transferred, the action may be
label: BODY

text: continued by or against the original party unless the court, on motion, orders the
label: BODY

text: transferee to be substituted in the action or joined with the original party.”  Fed. R. Civ.
label: BODY

text: 2. “The most significant feature of Rule 25(c) is that it does not require that anything be
label: BODY

text: done after an interest is transferred.  The action may be continued by or against the
label: BODY

text: original party, and the judgment will be binding on his successor-in-interest even though
label: BODY

text: he is not named.”  In re Bernal, 207 F.3d 595, 598 (9th Cir. 2000) (citing 7C Charles
label: BODY

text: Alan Wright, Arthur R. Miller & Mary Kay Kane, Federal Practice and Procedure § 1958
label: BODY

text: (2d Ed.1986)); see also Luxliner P.L. Export Co. v. RDI/Luxliner, Inc., 13 F.3d 69, 71
label: BODY

text: (3d Cir.1993); P P Inc. v. McGuire, 509 F. Supp. at 1083 (citing Froning's, Inc., 568 F.2d
label: BODY

text: 2 Inter vivos means among the living.  Transfers that occur because a served defendant has died are addressed below
label: BODY

text: Case 3:73-cv-00128-RCJ-WGC Document 2 Filed 02/23/11 Page 3 of 9
label: BODY

text: C-125-B/C-125-C:  Revised Proposed Successor-in-Interest Order
label: BODY

text: 108).  Thus, where a defendant has been served in a subproceeding and subsequently sells
label: BODY

text: or otherwise conveys a water right or portion of a water right subject to that
label: BODY

text: subproceeding, a successor-in-interest need not be re-served, but will be bound by the
label: BODY

text: results of this litigation.
label: BODY

text: 3. Once a defendant has been served in a subproceeding, the burden of keeping track of
label: BODY

text: inter vivos transfers of the defendant’s water rights in that subproceeding and substituting
label: BODY

text: the defendant’s successors-in-interest properly is born by the defendant and its
label: BODY

text: successor(s)-in-interest.  The action will continue in the name of the served defendant
label: BODY

text: until such time as the served defendant and any successor(s)-in-interest file an agreement
label: BODY

text: and motion seeking the substitution of the successor(s)-in-interest for the served
label: BODY

text: defendant and the Court approves that substitution.
label: BODY

text: 4. If a defendant who has been served in a subproceeding subsequently sells or otherwise
label: BODY

text: conveys a water right or a portion of a water right subject to that subproceeding, that
label: BODY

text: defendant and its successor(s)-in-interest may move for substitution pursuant to Fed. R.
label: BODY

text: Civ. P. 25(c).
label: BODY

text: 5. If the Court approves the substitution of a successor-in-interest for a served defendant in
label: BODY

text: a subproceeding, the action will continue against the successor-in-interest, who will be
label: BODY

text: treated as a served defendant for the pendency of the subproceeding and shall be bound
label: BODY

text: by the requirements of this Order and all prior and subsequent Orders in that
label: BODY

text: subproceeding.
label: BODY

text: in Section II.
label: BODY

text: Case 3:73-cv-00128-RCJ-WGC Document 2 Filed 02/23/11 Page 4 of 9
label: BODY

text: C-125-B/C-125-C:  Revised Proposed Successor-in-Interest Order
label: BODY

text: 6. If a defendant who has been served in a subproceeding subsequently acquires additional
label: BODY

text: water rights that are subject to that subproceeding, the prior service on the defendant shall
label: BODY

text: be effective as to all water rights held by that defendant, including any rights acquired
label: BODY

text: subsequent to service.
label: BODY

text: 7. The Court has approved the attached forms (Attachments A and B) for use by defendants
label: BODY

text: and their successors-in-interest in subproceedings C-125-B and C-125-C, respectively,
label: BODY

text: under the above circumstances.  Attachments A and B set forth a joint motion by which
label: BODY

text: both the current defendant and its successor(s)-in-interest may identify the rights
label: BODY

text: transferred and indicate their agreement that the successor(s)-in-interest be substituted
label: BODY

text: into the applicable subproceeding for the water rights addressed.  These forms are not the
label: BODY

text: exclusive means by which successors-in-interest may be substituted into this action.
label: BODY

text: II.
label: HH2

text: Treatment of Successors-in-Interest As a Result of a Death:
label: BODY

text: 8. The Court finds that Fed. R. Civ. P. 25(a) governs substitution of successors-in-interest as
label: BODY

text: a result of a death and provides, in relevant part:  “If a party dies and the claim is not
label: BODY

text: extinguished, the court may order substitution of the proper party.  A motion for
label: BODY

text: substitution may be made by any party or by the decedent’s successor or representative.
label: BODY

text: If the motion is not made within 90 days after service of a statement noting the death, the
label: BODY

text: action by or against the decedent must be dismissed.”  Fed. R. Civ. P. 25(a)(1).  If no
label: BODY

text: such notice or suggestion of death is made on the record, the case may proceed to
label: BODY

text: judgment with the original named parties.  4 James Wm. Moore et al., Moore’s Federal
label: BODY

text: Practice § 25.12[5], 25-20 (3d ed. 1997) (citing Ciccone v. Sec’y of Dep’t of Health and
label: BODY

text: Human Servs., 861 F.2d 14, 15 n.1 (2d Cir. 1988)).
label: BODY

text: 9. “Service of a statement noting the death” means the filing on the record in the applicable
label: BODY

text: subproceeding(s) and service of a statement that identifies the successor(s) to the estate
label: BODY

text: Case 3:73-cv-00128-RCJ-WGC Document 2 Filed 02/23/11 Page 5 of 9
label: BODY

text: C-125-B/C-125-C:  Revised Proposed Successor-in-Interest Order
label: BODY

text: who may be substituted for the decedent.  McSurely v. McClellan, 753 F.2d 88, 98 (D.C.
label: BODY

text: Cir. 1985); Rende v. Kay, 415 F.2d 983, 985-86 (D.C. Cir. 1969); Kessler v. Southeast
label: BODY

text: Permanente Med. Group of NC, P.A., 165 F.R.D. 54, 56 (E.D.N.C. 1995) (citing 7C
label: BODY

text: Charles A. Wright, et al., Federal Practice and Procedure § 1955 (1986 and Supp.1995));
label: BODY

text: see also Fed. R. Civ. P. 25(a)(3) (service requirements for a statement noting death).  Any
label: BODY

text: statement noting the death of a defendant must be filed in all applicable subproceeding(s).
label: BODY

text: In other words, if a decedent is only a defendant in subproceeding C-125-B, the notice
label: BODY

text: need only be filed in that case.  If, however, the decedent is a defendant in C-125-B and
label: BODY

text: C-125-C, the notice must be filed in both subproceedings.  A notice filed in one
label: BODY

text: subproceeding shall not be construed as “service of a statement noting the death” in the
label: BODY

text: other subproceeding for purposes of complying with this Order or FRCP 25(a).
label: BODY

text: 10. Should a death be formally noted on the record by service of a statement noting the death
label: BODY

text: that is filed in the appropriate subproceeding(s), the Tribe and United States, in the case
label: BODY

text: of C-125-B defendants, or Mineral County, in the case of C-125-C defendants, or any
label: BODY

text: other party or the decedent’s representative and/or successor(s)-in-interest shall move for
label: BODY

text: substitution of the proper successor-in-interest within 90 days of such notice pursuant to
label: BODY

text: Fed. R. Civ. P. 25(a).  The 90-day period may be extended pursuant to Rule 6(b), which
label: BODY

text: provides the Court the discretion to enlarge this period.  Fed. R. Civ. P. 6(b); see also
label: BODY

text: Fed. R. Civ. P. 6(b) 1963 amendment advisory committee’s note to 1963 amendment;
label: BODY

text: Fed. R. Civ. P. 25(1)(1) advisory committee’s note to 1963 amendment.
label: BODY

text: 11. Absent service of a statement noting the death in a subproceeding, the case may proceed
label: BODY

text: against the original named parties in that subproceeding and will bind any and all
label: BODY

text: successors-in-interest.
label: BODY

text: 12. If a successor-in-interest is already defendant in either subproceeding as a joint tenant or
label: BODY

text: pursuant to other joint ownership of the right(s) owned by the decedent, no action is
label: BODY

text: required and the subproceeding will continue against the successor-in-interest.
label: BODY

text: Case 3:73-cv-00128-RCJ-WGC Document 2 Filed 02/23/11 Page 6 of 9
label: BODY

text: C-125-B/C-125-C:  Revised Proposed Successor-in-Interest Order
label: BODY

text: III.
label: HH3

text: Treatment of Defendants in Subproceeding No. C-125-C Who Transferred Their
label: BODY

text: Interest(s) Prior to Service:
label: BODY

text: 13. The provisions of this Section III pertain only to Subproceeding C-125-C.  The approved
label: BODY

text: Service Package in Subproceeding C-125-B already includes an Order – Disclaimer of
label: BODY

text: Interest and form entitled Disclaimer of Interest in Water Rights and Notice of Related
label: BODY

text: Information and Documentation Supporting Disclaimer to address this issue.  If any
label: BODY

text: person or entity receiving service by mail or personal service has no interest in any water
label: BODY

text: right subject to subproceeding C-125-C, that person or entity shall notify the Court and
label: BODY

text: Mineral County in writing of that fact.
label: BODY

text: 14. If such a person or entity sold or otherwise conveyed ownership of all water rights
label: BODY

text: subject to Subproceeding C-125-C before being served or otherwise brought into
label: BODY

text: Subproceeding C-125-C, in addition to disclaiming any interest in C-125-C, that person
label: BODY

text: or entity shall include a notice providing the same successor-in-interest information
label: BODY

text: required to be included in a motion for substitution.
label: BODY

text: 15. The form and substance of the disclaimer and notice for C-125-C shall substantially
label: BODY

text: conform to the form attached to this Order as Exhibit C and shall be sent to the Court and
label: BODY

text: counsel for Mineral County.
label: BODY

text: 16. Any person or entity who files a Disclaimer of Interest using the attached form or
label: BODY

text: provides information for this purpose by other means is ultimately responsible for the
label: BODY

text: accuracy of that filing.  Consequently, any person or entity who files a notice regarding
label: BODY

text: water rights subject to this litigation, but retains such water rights, shall nevertheless be
label: BODY

text: bound by the results of this litigation.
label: BODY

text: Case 3:73-cv-00128-RCJ-WGC Document 2 Filed 02/23/11 Page 7 of 9
label: BODY

text: C-125-B/C-125-C:  Revised Proposed Successor-in-Interest Order
label: BODY

text: 17. Following its receipt from any person or entity disclaiming any interest in any of the
label: BODY

text: water rights at issue in this case, Mineral County will review the materials received, and,
label: BODY

text: if appropriate, request that the Court dismiss that person or entity from subproceeding C-
label: BODY

text: 18. If Mineral County does not receive a Waiver of Service of Notice in Lieu of Summons
label: BODY

text: and must personally serve a person or entity that subsequently files a Disclaimer of
label: BODY

text: Interest pursuant to this Order, Mineral County will review the materials received, and, if
label: BODY

text: appropriate, request that the Court dismiss the person or entity from subproceeding C-
label: BODY

text: 125-C, but that person or entity may be subject to paying the costs related to formal
label: BODY

text: personal service on them.
label: BODY

text: IV.
label: HH2

text: Notice to Parties
label: BODY

text: 19. The Plaintiff Parties shall provide periodic notice of developments in these proceedings
label: BODY

text: to other parties in this proceedings by mail and by publication as directed by further order
label: BODY

text: of this Court.
label: BODY

text: Duty to Provide Updated Information
label: BODY

text: 20. The Walker River Irrigation District, the Nevada State Engineer and the California Water
label: BODY

text: Resources Control Board shall regularly provide updated water right ownership
label: BODY

text: information to the Court and the Plaintiff Parties.  This information may be used to
label: BODY

text: provide notice of the pending proceedings to any new water rights owners.
label: BODY

text: IT IS SO ORDERED.
label: BODY

text: The Honorable Lawrence R. Leavitt
label: BODY

text: United States District Court Magistrate Judge
label: BODY
